Title: JabberD 2.x: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Gentoo's JabberD 2.x
    ebuild, the worst of which allows local attackers to escalate privileges.

Background.Text: JabberD 2.x is an open source Jabber server written in C.

Description.Text: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Gentooâ€™s JabberD 2.x ebuild. Please review the referenced CVE identifiers for details.

Impact.Text: An attacker could possibly escalate privileges by owning system binaries in trusted locations, cause a Denial of Service condition by manipulating the PID file from jabberd2 services, bypass security via SASL ANONYMOUS connections or have other unspecified impacts.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text:
Gentoo has discontinued support for JabberD 2.x and recommends that
      users unmerge the package:

As an alternative, users may want to upgrade their systems to use
      net-im/prosody instead of net-im/jabberd2.
